articles.title: Aston Villa's Watkins claims Havertz goal should have counted in shocking admission after Arsenal draw (WATCH)
articles.description: Aston Villa star Ollie Watkins has unexpectedly claimed that Arsenal were unfairly penalized when their third goal was disallowed for a handball during Saturday's exciting 2-2 draw. The Gunners initially took the lead with Gabriel Martinelli's goal, followed by Kai Havertz extending their advantage early in the second half. However, Youri Tielemans and Watkins struck to level the score. This result came on the same day Liverpool secured a late win over Brentford, further widening the gap at the top of the Premier League, as Aston Villa once again frustrated Arsenal at the Emirates. As the Gunners pressed for a crucial fifth goal, Havertz believed he had added to his tally when Mikel Merino's shot deflected off him in the dying moments of the match. However, following a VAR review, it was determined that the ball had struck Havertz's arm, not his midriff as he had argued. As a result, the game ended 2-2, with the points shared. Kai Havertz "handball" in slow motion. Please tell me I'm not going crazy but where's the handball ? pic.twitter.com/FKWIFcVavD ‚Äî EmanDaGoonTM (@EmanDaGoon) January 18, 2025 Afterward, Watkins told Sky he was 'not sure' the correct decision had been made, even though it was a call that worked in his team's favour. "Seeing it back there I am not sure, think it‚Äôs gone in favour for us, if that was against me I think I would be disappointed," he told Sky Sports. "From that angle I‚Äôm not sure but that‚Äôs what VAR is there for." Ollie Watkins on Arsenal‚Äôs disallowed goal: ‚ÄúSeeing it back there, I think it‚Äôs gone in favour of us. If that was against me, I would be disappointed. I‚Äôm not sure, but that‚Äôs what VAR is there for.‚Äù üé• @SkySportsPL #ArsenalFanaticsNews pic.twitter.com/0oqInmOLLv ‚Äî #COYG #ArsenalFanaticsNews (@Arsenal23Wenger) January 18, 2025 "We got the goal from Youri, we went up the pitch and he nearly scored again. Got a lot of momentum from that and faith when we went forward on transition there was chances to be had. We knew they went man-for-man, Gabriel on me, Partey on Jacob, we were man-for-man at the back and a few times I could have done better in first-half. Chances there to be taken and they [Arsenal] were always a little bit open," Watkins added. It was a tough result for the Gunners, who have now won just once in their last five matches across all competitions. A draw with Brighton was followed by consecutive home defeats in the cup against Newcastle and Manchester United, with the Villa draw coming after a midweek victory in the north London derby. Havertz, however, seemed to believe he had done enough to secure an important late win, celebrating his deflected goal before it was ruled out by VAR. While Havertz may have been uncertain, Paul Merson in the Sky Sports studio had no doubts about the legitimacy of the "goal." "I can't believe Havertz has run away. It's hit his hand and he's run off. I can understand if it's in the Championship, you're going to get away with it, there's no VAR," Merson said. Lee Hendrie appeared just as doubtful about Havertz's reaction, saying, "As a player, surely you know." Merson chimed in, adding, "It's not a tight one!" Following the frustration of Saturday's draw at home, Arsenal will need to regroup ahead of their midweek Champions League clash with Dinamo Zagreb. Meanwhile, Villa will be preparing for a trip to Monaco on Tuesday, aiming to put themselves in the best position to advance to the next round of Europe‚Äôs premier competition.

articles.description: Star-studded Intrusion: Saif Ali Khan's Stabbing Raises Alarming Questions In a startling incident that has shaken Bollywood, actor Saif Ali Khan was stabbed multiple times by an intruder at his Mumbai apartment. The 30-year-old assailant, originally named Mohammad Shariful Islam Shehzad from Bangladesh, was taken into custody by police on Sunday.The suspect, who adopted the alias Bijoy Das upon entering India, allegedly intended to commit theft and managed to infiltrate Khan's Bandra residence early Thursday morning. This attack has triggered debates on celebrity security and living conditions.Khan, aged 54, was immediately taken to Lilavati Hospital, where he underwent emergency surgery following the 2.30 am incident. Hospital sources confirm he is recovering well and expected to be discharged soon.

articles.title: Maharashtra's New Guardian Ministers: A Political Shuffle
articles.description: Maharashtra's New Guardian Ministers: A Political Shuffle The Maharashtra government has released a new list of guardian ministers, sparking political debate. Notably absent from the list is NCP leader and Food and Civil Supplies minister Dhananjay Munde, whose exclusion has raised eyebrows given his previous role as guardian minister of Beed district.With the formation of the BJP-NCP-Shiv Sena coalition, significant reshuffling has occurred, placing key figures like Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar in pivotal district roles. Fadnavis, handling the Home department, is now the guardian of the Naxal-affected Gadchiroli district, while Pawar will oversee Beed and Pune, his home district.Tensions have risen following controversies, including the murder case involving Munde‚Äôs associate, Walmik Karad. Despite calls for Munde's resignation, Ajit Pawar maintained support for him. This reshuffling represents a strategic move in Maharashtra's evolving political landscape.

articles.title: Saif Ali Khan Stabbed: Inside the Dramatic Arrest of the Suspect Behind the Shocking Attack
articles.description: In a shocking turn of events, a suspect linked to the stabbing of Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan has been detained by the Railway Protection Force in Chhattisgarh. The suspect, identified as Aakash Kanojia, was apprehended on January 18 while traveling on the Jnaneshwari Express from Mumbai to Kolkata. CCTV footage has confirmed his resemblance to the attacker who brutally stabbed Khan multiple times during a robbery attempt at his Mumbai residence. The attack left Khan with severe injuries, requiring emergency surgery to remove a piece of the blade lodged in his spine. Watch the video for details.
